meanings.definition: Serving as a desirable model; representing the best of its kind.
meanings.sent1: Her exemplary behavior in class set a good example for others to follow.
meanings.sent2: The student received an exemplary grade on the test for his outstanding work.
meanings.sent3: The exemplary student always remembered to bring extra pencils for classmates in need.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to his craft was truly exemplary, shining brighter than the rest.
meanings.sent5: The exemplary sunset painted the sky in vibrant hues, leaving everyone in awe.

meanings.sent1: The chef's exemplary cooking skills made her dishes a delight to savor.
meanings.sent2: His exemplary leadership during the crisis earned him the respect of his team.
meanings.sent3: The exemplary gardener grew a garden so beautiful, even the birds sang praises.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness towards strangers was truly exemplary, a beacon of light in a dark world.
meanings.sent5: The exemplary performance of the orchestra moved the audience to tears of joy.

meanings.definition: Serving as a warning or deterrent.
meanings.sent1: The exemplary punishment for breaking the rules made others think twice.
meanings.sent2: The guard dog's exemplary bark scared away any potential intruders.
meanings.sent3: The exemplary sign at the edge of the cliff warned hikers of the danger ahead.
meanings.sent4: His exemplary caution while handling chemicals prevented a potential disaster.
meanings.sent5: The exemplary thunderstorm served as a powerful reminder of nature's force.
